alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 11:44PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern De Soto, southern Red River, west central Natchitoches and northern Sabine Parishes, east central Nacogdoches, southeastern Shelby, northern San Augustine and northwestern Sabine Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1143 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Mansfield to 8 miles southwest of Converse to 6 miles east of Melrose. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Milam, Many, San Augustine, Zwolle, Converse, Patroon, Bland Lake, Rosevine, Macune, Allen, Oak Grove, Pleasant Hill, Chireno, Huxley, Noble, Robeline, Powhatan, Lake End, Belmont and Pelican. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for eastern Texas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for northwestern Louisiana...and eastern Texas.
